1:
A wise son hears his father's instruction,\q but a mocker will not listen to rebuke.
\q
2:
From the fruit of his mouth a person enjoys good things,\q but the appetite of the treacherous is for violence.


\q
3:
The one who guards his mouth protects his life,\q but the one who opens wide his lips will ruin himself.
\q
4:
The appetite of lazy people craves but gets nothing,\q but the appetite of diligent people will be richly satisfied.

\q
5:
The righteous person hates lies,\q but a wicked person makes himself repugnant, and he does what is shameful.
\q
6:
Righteousness protects those who are faultless in their path,\q but wickedness turns away those who commit sin.


\q
7:
There is someone who enriches himself, but has nothing at all,\q and there is someone who gives everything away, yet is truly wealthy.
\q
8:
The ransom of a rich man's life is his wealth,\q but a poor person does not hear a threat.


\q
9:
The light of righteous people rejoices,\q but the lamp of wicked people will be put out.
\q
10:
Pride only breeds conflict,\q but for those who listen to good advice there is wisdom.


\q
11:
Wealth dwindles away when there is too much vanity,\q but the one who makes money by working with his hand will make his money grow.
\q
12:
When hope is postponed, it breaks the heart,\q but a longing fulfilled is a tree of life.


\q
13:
The one who scorns instruction will still be subject to it,\q but the one who honors the command will be rewarded.
\q
14:
The teaching of a wise person is a fountain of life,\q turning you away from the snares of death.


\q
15:
Good insight wins favor,\q but the way of the treacherous is never-ending.
\q
16:
Prudent people act out of knowledge in every decision,\q but a fool parades his folly.


\q
17:
A wicked messenger falls into trouble,\q but a faithful envoy brings reconciliation.
\q
18:
The one who ignores instruction will have poverty and shame,\q but honor will come to him who learns from correction.


\q
19:
A longing realized is sweet to the appetite,\q but fools hate to turn away from evil.
\q
20:
Walk with wise people and you will be wise,\q but the companion of fools will suffer harm.


\q
21:
Disaster runs after sinners,\q but righteous people are rewarded with good.
\q
22:
A good person leaves an inheritance for his grandchildren,\q but a sinner's wealth is stored up for the righteous person.

\q
23:
An unplowed field owned by the poor could produce much food,\q but it is swept away by injustice.
\q
24:
The one who does not discipline his son hates him,\q but one who loves his son is careful to instruct him.


\q
25: The righteous person eats until he satisfies his appetite,\q but the stomach of the wicked is always hungry.
